intro: Crotalaria pilosiflora, commonly known as the hairy-flowered crotalaria, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Fabaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers with a hairy calyx. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with upright stems and palmately lobed leaves. Its flowers are often clustered in racemes and attract various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Crotalaria pilosiflora is known for its ability to thrive in poor soils and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
